{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21921].
  {panel}

These two new columns have been added in the 3.X upgrade obviously as I do not see them in our legacy 2.X DB (and the CONTENTTYPE column)
In practice the value for the 2 columns is always 0 be it a page watch or space watch.

For some mysterious reason, an existing row was not set to 0/0 for these two columns for ONE page.
All the other ones are good.

The consequence is that when you select the tab "watches" for the user having the watch on the page, it blows up.
(See the exception in the comment).
If I add in the DB the missing 0 for the 'digest', the message will change and it will be the equivalent for the 'network' value.
When the missing 0s are added the issue disappears.
If I remove them, it comes back.

Suggestions:
- investigate how you could not have 0, 0 inserted here. We do not mess up directly with the DB. We use either the UI or the remote API but this page and watch were close to one year old (according to last updated dates), so older than our migration from 2.10.3 to 3.4.X
- add a NOT NULL constraint on these 2 columns new in 3.X AT THE END of the DB upgrade.
- do something in you hibernate mapping to interpret NULL for these two columns as 0.

If you want to reproduce
- have a user watching a page
- edit the row in the NOTIFICATIONS table removing the two 0s
- as this user, click on your profile then go to the watches tab section to see all your watches and it should blow up.

The problem is resolved on my side.
fields.summary: System error on a bad row for a page watch, add a not null constraint on NOTIFICATIONS.DIGEST and NOTIFICATIONS.NETWORK and/or fix hibernate mapping

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21916].
  {panel}

It would be very useful to be able create a link to the current version of a page that didn't track updates as they are made in future.

It is already possible to create a link to a historical page, but the latest version always tracks the current version. To simulate the functionality I want I am forced to make a trivial change to the page and then grab a link to the now historical version.

For example. A page has 3 versions

3. (CURRENT)
2.
1.

It is possible to get a link to versions 1+2 but not 3 because if I make a change like so

4. (CURRENT)
3.
2.
1.

The link to 3 previously now points to 4. 

Obviously most of the time this feature is essential, but sometimes I would like to be able to grab a link that didn't get updated (specifically I have a use-case for release notes, where i want to link to a snapshot of documentation)
fields.summary: ability to link to absolute version of current version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21858].
  {panel}

Background:

Studio has the suckiest raciest flimsiest ugliest mechanism for ensuring that JIRA, Confluence, FishEye and Bamboo all have trusted apps relationships with each other.  If you don't believe me, ask Charles, and watch him shiver.  A combination of wanting to fix this, and that this mechanism is not compatible with UAL, has led the Studio team to actually attempt to fix it.  Our strategy is to make JIRA, Confluence, FishEye and Bamboo all use the same trusted apps keys, this means that nothing needs to be done to sync them all together, as long as each app trusts its own certificates, they will all be in sync.

So, there are three pieces of information that must be the same across all three apps, the private key, the public key, and the application ID.  The application ID must be the same because each app will add their own applicaiton ID to each signed request, and then that application ID will have to be the ID at the remote end because it uses that ID to look up the applications it trusts.  This is where Confluence fails.  com.atlassian.confluence.security.trust.DefaultTrustedApplicationsManager has a hard coded mechanism for generating a trusted application id from the SID, it can't be overridden.

Some ideas for implementing this may be:

* Check bandana for an application ID before using the SID based one
* Store trusted apps id in ApplicationConfiguration
* Add a flag to the KEYSTORE table to indicate which key is the current application key
* Allow a system property to override the application ID
* Define some sort of mechanism for plugging into the thing that generates the application ID
fields.summary: Allow a custom current application ID to be used for trusted apps

Currently, when CamelCase Linking is enabled, you must use the nl or nolink syntax to unlink a word that is camel-cased.  However, this only works for unlinking an individual string.  If CamelCase Linking creates links within strings, unlinking should be permitted within strings as well.

For example:
C:\CamelCase_Test\Whatever

C:\{nl:CamelCase}_Test\Whatever

Trying to unlink CamelCase does not work like this.  It will only work if there is whitespace surrounding the tag:

C:\ {nl:CamelCase} _Test\Whatever

But then, if someone wanted to copy and paste the link, it would be invalid.
fields.summary: Allow Unlinking Within a Single String

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21836].
  {panel}

The PermissionManager's transaction proxy is set up like this:

{code:xml}
<!-- from securityContext.xml -->
    <bean id="permissionManager" class="org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionProxyFactoryBean" plugin:available="true">
        <property name="transactionManager">
            <ref bean="transactionManager"/>
        </property>
        <property name="target">
            <ref local="permissionManagerTarget"/>
        </property>
        <property name="transactionAttributes">
            <props>
                <prop key="get*">PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,readOnly</prop>
                <prop key="is*">PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,readOnly</prop>
                <prop key="*">PROPAGATION_REQUIRED</prop>
            </props>
        </property>
        <property name="proxyInterfaces">
            <value>com.atlassian.confluence.security.PermissionManager</value>
        </property>
        <property name="postInterceptors">
            <list>
                <ref bean="profilingInterceptor"/>
            </list>
        </property>
    </bean>
{code}

But some of its readonly methods have "has" prefixes.  This leads to unnecessary read-write transactions and thus extra commits.

Eg 
{noformat}
	com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyConnection.commit(NewProxyConnection.java:803)
	net.sf.hibernate.transaction.JDBCTransaction.commit(JDBCTransaction.java:63)
	org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doCommit(HibernateTransactionManager.java:510)
	org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.processCommit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:662)
	org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.commit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:632)
	org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAspectSupport.commitTransactionAfterReturning(TransactionAspectSupport.java:314)
	org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:116)
	org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	$Proxy22.hasCreatePermission(Unknown Source)
	com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.web.conditions.user.UserCanUpdateUserStatusCondition.shouldDisplay(UserCanUpdateUserStatusCondition.java:17)
	com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.web.conditions.BaseConfluenceCondition.shouldDisplay(BaseConfluenceCondition.java:30)
{noformat}
fields.summary: PermissionManager should only require readonly transaction for has* methods

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21794].
  {panel}

Friendly dates are dates displayed like 'yesterday, 3 hours ago, two days ago...'
The methods come from
getFriendlyDate() - Method in class com.atlassian.confluence.userstatus.actions.UserStatusJsonResult
getFriendlyDateFormatter() - Method in class com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceActionSupport 
In some places such as page comments, there is also a tooltip giving the exact timestamp (date + time)
In other places, such as the history of the navigation (a good old popup), this is not the case.

The problems are that:
- there is no visual way to distinguish if '3 hours ago' is before '3 hours ago' for another comment because this is a 'rounded' time. You need to look at the tooltips and tooltips are not present everywhere
- when you print you get also the friendly dates
- our QA DON'T want friendly dates. It goes against our governmental standard of using ISO dates.
- I had a look at the source code that we have and there is 
- I use a custom theme and there is no way to replace the FriendlyDateFormatter injected in the actions (through a factory, setting, no setter and private field) (so I need to bypass the private protection if I want to do it, doing this in each overriden vmd file...)

I can change the date and time format in the administration panel for the general configuration for date, time, date+time...
There is nothing equivalent for the friendly date.

I suggest to add a setting in the administration with a selection list for the friendly date
- default behavior (current one, default setting)
- display the Date Time Format (using the format defined upper)
- display the Date Format (using the format defined upper)

The expected result should be that all the friendly dates (normal pages, popups...) will use this setting.
fields.summary: Provide a way to turn off globally "friendly dates" or to use an alternate format

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test Space and Page as the following hierarchy
#* Space
#** Home
#*** A
#**** A1
#***** A11
#***** A12
#**** A2
#*** B
# Assign a View Page restriction to *Home*. So all the child pages will inherit the View page restriction.
# Delete Page *A*
# Notice that child pages of *A* will become orphaned and will no more have the inherited View page restriction:
#* Space
#** A1
#*** A11
#*** A12
#** A2
#** Home
#*** B

h5. Workaround
Move the child pages back to their parent, as for the example above, to be under *Home*. So they will inherit the same View Page restriction again.

Hi,

Draft of a new page is irrevocable lost if the user tries to create a new page.

1. Create a new page, and don't save.
2. Enter some text in the page, and be sure a draft save is triggered.
3. Open another window tab.

    A new page you were adding on Jan 17, 2011 09:55 called 'testing draft' was not saved. Do you want to resume editing or discard it?

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21490].
  {panel}

Popular labels macro does not allow any applied style to the background for heatmap display, this can also not be overridden in the spaces "Stylesheet" settings as the style has been applied at the element level.

I have a few solutions:

h3.Add Full Style Attributes to Macro

This is the most workable and user-friendly way to customise the macro, add following attributes to macro:

* background-color
* border
* border-color
* border-style

h3.Add background-color Attribute

Not the most ideal, but it is fairly workable, allow for transparent background-color (specify a color of ''), users can then style the border by placing the macro inside a {{panel}} macro.

h3.Move Style Attributes to Stylesheet

The least user-friendly, but it allows users to control the look of the labels macro by using their custom stylesheet for the space.

h3.Current Solution

I do have a workaround without having to modify the source for those interested. What you need to do is go to "Administration > Look and Feel > Custom HTML" and add the following to the {{HEAD}} section.

{code:html}
<script type='text/javascript' language='javascript'>
AJS.$(function($) {
  $(".heatmap ul").css("background-color", "");
});
</script>
{code}

*note*: This technique has two caveats.

# It is applied to all spaces, you can control this by testing for the spaces key.
# There will be a flicker of gray to no color when the pages first load with heatmaps in them.
fields.summary: Allow styling to popular-labels macro

I have a page with lots of attachments - in the Attachments View there are 5 pages of attachments. The attachments are images named e.g. P1040697, P1040698, P1040699 ... P1040798. They were all uploaded at "the same" time, IIRC it was through a UWC import. At any rate they all have the same timestamp. (Screenshot 1)
The default display on page 1 is not by Attachment name. It is useful for me to view the attachments list by name so I re-sort by Name. (Screenshot 2) If I then open the attachment properties for any given attachment, add a comment, and then return to the Attachments View page the "sort by name" setting is lost and I am back to the first page of the natural sort order - it's now evident that the natural sort order is by "modified date" as the attachment with the new comment added is now at the start of the list. (Screenshot 3) 
If I didn't make any changes to the attachment properties (e.g. hit the "Cancel" button) I'm still returned to the first page, in natural sort order, the attachment that I had selected before isn't even visible on the page.

It would be much better to 
# remember what is the sort order for the current attachments view page at least in the current session
# set a "default" attachment sort order in the attachments view page and store it for the user for any future session - this should be set for all "attachments view" pages once chosen, or can be returned to the global default sort order at the user's discretion.
